div.l: A Prentis whylom dwelt in our cyte
Of crafte of vytayllers was he

As gaylard he was as goldfynche in þᵉ
shawe
Broun as a bery a propre short felawe
Wyth lockes y kembyd full fetously
Daunce he cowde well and Iolyly
Then he was clepyd perkyn reuelour
He was as full of loue and paramour
As is the hyue full of hony swete
Wel was the wenche þᵗat wyth hym myght slepe
And at euery brydale wolde he synge ⁊and hoppe
He louid better the nether ende than the shoppe
For whan there ony rydynge was in chepe
Out of the shoppe thyder wolde he lepe
Tyll that he hadde all the syght y seen
And daunsed wel he wolde not come ayen
And gadryd hym a meyne of his sorte
To hoppe and synge and make suche disporte
And there they sette steuene for to mete
To playn at the dyse in suche a strete
For in the towne was there no prentyse
That fayrer cowde caste a payre of dyse
Than perkyn cowde and therto he was free
Of his dispence in place of preuytee
That fonde his mayster well in his chaffare
For oftyme he fonde his boxe full bare
For shortly a prentis that is a reuelour
That hauntyth dyse ryot and paramour
His mayster shall it in his shoppe abye
All haue he no part of the mynstralsye
For thefte and ryot they be conuertyble
All can he playe on gytterne or rybyble
Reuell and trouthe as in a lowe degre
They be full wroth aldaye as men maye se
¶This Ioly prenstis wyth his mayster stode
Tyll he was nere out of his prentishode
All were he snybbed bothe erly and late
And somtyme lad wyth reuell to newgate
But at laste his mayster hym bethoughte
On a daye whan he his paper soughte
Vpon a prouerbe that sayth this same worde
Well bet is rotyn apple oute of horde
Than that he roteth all the remenaunt
So faryth it by a ryotous seruaunt
It is full lasse harme to late hym pace
Than he sholde all the seruauntis in the plac
